intro: Aspidogyne longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract aspidogyne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while the flowers are clustered in cymes. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
